result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kiefer J. Beran

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:19 PM Defendant Kiefer J. Beran in court, in custody.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Zaleski, also present in court, appeared on all other pending cases.  Atty Zaleski advises defendant was denied entry into Iowa County DTC and is currently trying to get into Grant County DTC, which pauses the agreement(s) previously worked out.   Court will set trial dates in 19CF79 due to age of this case.  The other cases will track.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.   Infomation filed.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of the information.  Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Petition to Assign Cases Subject to Disqualification and Chief Judge Order Specifically Assigning Cases

9:17 AM Defendant Kiefer J. Beran appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zaleski appears via video, making a special appearance. Defendant advised to call the SPD for appointment in this matter.  Defendant wishes to proceed to initial with special appearance today.   Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of complaint.  Time limits waived for initial appearance.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
